subSections.title: Punctuation mark
subSections.text:
{{head|zh|symbol}}

# {{non-gloss definition|Used in casual writing as an abbreviation of a repeated character, in vertical writing.}}

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: {{zh-l|二}} (usually appearing as {{lang|zh|〻}}) is used in casual writing to represent a doubled character in vertical writing, but is never used in formal writing or printed matter.
